description: Product liability - defective product causes injury
facts: Consumer purchased a new blender from a retail store
The blender's blade detached during normal use
Consumer suffered cuts to their hand
Investigation revealed a manufacturing defect in the blade assembly
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, product_liability). defendant(c1, manufacturer). plaintiff(c1, consumer). product_type(c1, blender). defect_type(c1, manufacturing). product_used_normally(c1, yes). defect_caused_injury(c1, yes). actual_cause(c1, yes). proximate_cause(c1, yes). damages(c1, 3000). injury_type(c1, physical).
question: Is the manufacturer liable for the consumer's injuries?
rationale: Under strict product liability, manufacturers are liable for injuries caused by defective products. A manufacturing defect that causes the blade to detach during normal use makes the manufacturer strictly liable regardless of fault.
